newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Swedish PM says to announce EMU view May 23-31.
newsitem.headline: Swedish PM says to announce EMU view May 23-31.

text.p: Sweden's Prime Minister Goran Persson said on Thursday the minority Social Democratic government would announce its view on membership in Europe's economic and monetary union (EMU) sometime between May 23-31.
"We had planned to make our view public on May 23 but an important meeting came up in the mean time," Persson said.

Persson repeated that an announcement would be made before the end of May. Persson's spokeswoman later confirmed that she understood his comment to mean an answer could be expected between May 23 and the end of the month.
Persson said a definite no was not necessarily on the cards.
"It's not definitely 'no' to EMU. A no can always be changed later. The only answer that can't be changed is saying yes right away," Persson said.
He said he had no reason to change his opinion from the time when he was Sweden's finance minister about the economic advantages of EMU.
